posts.name: Cafe Bourbon Street
posts.note: Cafe Bourbon Street is an alternative, and independent music acts perform at this intimate, laid-back bar with an edgy vibe. At this punk bar, you need to order the perogies.

posts.name: The Crispy Coop
posts.note: From The Crispy Coop website, 'For fans of the locally famous Uncle Nick’s Greek Fried Chicken, you’ll love how we’ve re-imagined your favorite crispy fried chicken. At The Crispy Coop, we’re serving our traditional fried chicken flavor with two new flavor options: Nashville Hot and Tennessee Mild.' NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: The Eagle Food and Beer Hall
posts.note: The Eagle Food and Beer Hall is an indoor/outdoor eatery and beer hall dishing up fried chicken and other comfort classics. They are known for their fried chicken and other Southern food staples. From their website, ‘At the Eagle, house-brined and dredged Fried Chicken and Southern Sides are the stars of the show. With “Best Of” accolades around the country, our chicken brings people together. We source free-range, all-natural birds and couple it with classic southern side dishes, sandwiches, and carefully curated cocktails, along with a select list of local craft beers and other American favorites. This is approachable, comfort food done right.’

posts.name: Fox in the Snow Cafe
posts.note: Fox in the Snow Cafe is an airy coffee shop featuring java drinks, baked goods, tarts, and biscuits in a modernized garage space. You can't go wrong ordering the cinnamon rolls with it's, and delicious frosting or the chocolate filled donuts or the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich with a bit of spicy mustard/horseradish mayo. I would have liked to get there blueberry scone or seasonal peach Galette/tart. From their website, 'Fox in the Snow Cafe is a bakery, coffee shop serving up rustic-style baked goods and hand-poured drinks out of three quaint shops in the Italian Village, German Village and New Albany neighborhoods of Columbus, Ohio. NOTE: They have more than one location.'

posts.name: Graeter's Ice Cream
posts.note: Graeter’s Ice Cream is a longtime ice cream parlor chain serving small-batch scoops plus baked goods at some locations. They have some of the best ice creams in the country, no matter which flavor you try. From their website, ‘Still, family-owned, Graeter’s is the last ice cream still crafted in French Pots, just 2 1/2 gallons at a time. Since 1870, four generations of the Graeter family have remained committed to handcrafting only the most indulgent ice cream available. From humble beginnings serving ice cream from a cart in Cincinnati to the nationwide presence of Graeter’s Ice Cream today, the family has stubbornly held to ideals and processes of the founding generation.’ NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Hot Chicken Takeover
posts.note: Hot Chicken Takeover serves spicy Nashville-style fried chicken and Southern sides in a barn like space with counter service. The mac and cheese was good, but I liked their Cole Slaw better. So see if you can get two orders of the Cole Slaw instead of one of each with your meal. Watch a video about Hot Chicken Takeover's mission of employing former prisoners. From their website, 'In the fall of 2013, we experienced Nashville’s famous hot chicken culture for the first time. The taste, the smells, the mix of people in the restaurants – we were instantly hooked. When we returned, we experimented non-stop. Night after night, we tested out new twists on our own hot chicken recipe. Soon we started serving friends of friends, and then we finally served our first group of strangers (in a random parking lot, if you can believe it).' NOTE: They are open daily from 11:00 AM - 3:00 PM at this location and have multiple other locations open extended hours.

posts.name: Katzinger's Delicatessen
posts.note: Katzinger’s Delicatessen is a long-running joint serving deli classics, including Reuben’s, smoked fish, and matzo ball soup. From their website, ‘We’re very proud of our food – Black Angus corned beef prepared by Sy Ginsburg’s United Meat and Deli using Sy’s special secret ingredient (many, many tons of corned beef later, and he still won’t tell us what it is!), chickens raised by Amish families at Gerber Farms, imported Emmentaler – the original Swiss cheese, breads made especially for us and delivered daily by Mediterra Bakehouse in Pittsburgh (and we hand slice every loaf), bagels from Sammy’s delivered fresh daily and gluten-free bread. We roast our turkeys to moist perfection. We dress our roast beef with lots of garlic and rosemary and roast it to a beautifully pink medium-rare. We marinate our brisket for 48 hours before slow roasting to fork tenderness. Our chicken, tuna, and egg salad are made with memorable recipes.’ NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Loops
posts.note: Loops serve hot dogs, gyros, sandwiches, and this casual restaurant offers other simple eats. Order the Italian beef with spicy peppers sandwich. From their website, 'We are proud to bring these delicious sandwiches to Columbus along with our own original creations and twists on these amazing classics. From our original LOOPS Spicy Gyro Roll to a loaded Chicago hotdog, smoked beef polish sausages, fresh carved gyros, pork chop sandwiches smothered in onions, and the always famous Italian Beef, sliced thin and topped with authentic giardiniera (the wetter, the better!)'

posts.name: Los Guachos
posts.note: Los Guachos is a petite taqueria with counter service, famous for its tacos al pastor and other regional antojitos. From their website, 'Born to a humble family of taqueros, the Nonatos have had a long history of preparing some of the finest tacos in Mexico. With an unparalleled work ethic and a love for food, they immigrated to the United States with the hope of one day owning their very own successful business. After years of hard work, they were able to save up enough money to purchase their very own taco truck. Full of pride and eager to start a new chapter in their life, the taco truck quietly became a huge success. Every day more and more people waited in line to enjoy the best tacos in the city. Humbled and grateful by the sight of their success, they decided that the customers needed better dining accommodations. Once again, they took a risk by opening their first brick and mortar restaurant on Godown Road in Columbus, Ohio. The lines didn't slow down and steadily grew. Today, Los Guachos employees over 50 people and has three restaurants around Columbus and Gahanna along with the original humble taco truck that helped put their American dream in motion. Special thanks to our customers for being a part of this wonderful journey. We are forever grateful.' From their website, NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Mission Coffee Co.
posts.note: Mission Coffee Co. is a brick-walled coffeehouse brewing specialty beans in an industrial setting with handcrafted tables. The loose leaf oolong tea uses fresh herbs/leaves. Charming little place of the main drag of North High St. to relax and get some work done at some communal tables along with some comfy chairs to sit and read for a bit. From their website, 'We’ve been working in coffee for over ten years, committed to the culture and community that stand behind the importance of a great product. With big dreams and lifelong aspirations come late nights, long hours, and seemingly endless tasks. In everything that we have done and continue to do, we always come back to the most reliable element, our first true love: the coffee.'

posts.name: Momo Ghar
posts.note: Momo Ghar is family owned and operated. The popular Himalayan dumpling restaurant began in Saraga International Market. Momo Ghar is well known for their MOMOs which are Himalayan dumplings filled with meat and/or vegetables. Order the Chicken Chhoila Set which is marinated chicken with chickpeas and rice. Or the Kothey which are Tibetan-style dumplings. From their website, 'Momo Ghar is well known for their MOMOs which are Himalayan dumplings filled with meat and/or vegetables. All items on their menu are fresh and handmade from scratch, including their spicy sauces. In addition to MOMOs, Momo Ghar serves a selection of fresh side dishes such as Baara, a Nepali cake made of lentils, and Chhoila set, a traditional dish from Kathmandu, the capital of Nepal, featuring spicy grilled chicken, black-eyed peas, and crispy rice, and Milk Tea which is a British blend tea with milk and sugar that is very popular in Nepal.' NOTE: They have more than one location.

posts.name: North Market
posts.note: The North Market is a public market located in Downtown Columbus. Four of the places listed as part of my Columbus, OH list are in this market such as Hot Chicken Takeout, Momo Ghar Market, Pistacia Vera, and Katzinger's Deli. From their website, 'North Market is a destination that serves over one million guests each year and is consistently ranked as one of the top public markets in the country. We proudly provide an authentic Columbus, Ohio experience that highlights the diversity and vibrancy of our community, both economically and culturally, by promoting and incubating “best in class” local, independent businesses. Our heritage can be traced back to 1876. Across many transitions, economic ups and downs, and countless merchants, vendors, and visitors, North Market stands today, stronger than ever, as a symbol of our community’s resilience, cultural diversity, and success.'

posts.name: One Line Coffee - Short North
posts.note: The One Line Coffee Short North location is a brick-accented coffee bar offering house-roasted beans, local pastries, and weekend brewing workshops. They have a great selection of coffees and some teas too. In the back, there are five or six small tables to get some work done and even a couple of comfy chairs to sit and read a bit. From theirwebsite, 'On any given day, we’re always preparing several of our current coffee offerings via pour-over by way of the Hario v60…., and we also offer three batch-brew options for those customers who need to grab and go! Enjoy espresso pulled from one of the rarest machines in the world, the La Marzocco Strada EP, or watch our baristas use that espresso to create beautiful art on a latte or cappuccino. We even offer a single origin chocolate from Askinosie to sweeten up your beverage, as well as a selection of signature espresso beverages…including the ever-popular honey latte.' NOTE: They have more than one location.

posts.name: Pistacia Vera
posts.note: Pistacia Vera is a quaint cafe with sidewalk seats for homemade macaroon, pastries, and other sweets, plus light fare. You need to try their rye croissant and the tomato Galette along with a hot chocolate that they add a small home-made marshmallow too. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Ray Ray's Hog Pit
posts.note: Ray Ray's Hog Pit meats are hardwood-smoked and served from the window of this year-round food truck open late-week. You need to order the pork burger. From their website, 'It’s not in the sauce — it’s in your soul. That’s what sets Ray Ray’s Hog Pit apart. You can’t rush barbecue. Select cuts of pork, beef and chicken are dry rubbed and cooked low and slow for the hint of hickory and honesty of oak that only 12 to 16 hours in a hardwood smoker can create. Traditional and original sauces — sweet and savory, jalapeño to habanero — always on the side so as not to hide the pink smoke ring only found in authentic barbecue.'

posts.name: The Roosevelt Coffeehouse
posts.note: The Roosevelt Coffeehouse is a coffeehouse built to fight the worldwide and local injustices of hunger, unclean water, sex trafficking, and slavery. Profits from our roaster support initiatives that fight hunger, unclean water, and human trafficking. We exist to end these injustices, so we roast our coffee with care—for the farmer, for the quality, and for the people in need that our coffee impacts.

posts.name: Schmidt's Sausage Shop
posts.note: Schmidt's Sausage Shop has an all-you-can-eat sausage buffet which typically has four different types of sausage and a few sides of veggies. Most importantly don't forget to order the enormous chocolate filled cream puffs for dessert. From the Food Network website, 'Schmidt's Sausage Haus in Columbus is the place to be for authentic German food. Under the sounds of live oompah music, the restaurant serves up favorites like Weiner Schnitzel, and Sauerkraut-Bratwurst Balls served with a creamy mustard sauce.'

posts.name: Stauf's Coffee Roasters
posts.note: From the Stauf's Coffee Roasters website, 'In 1988, Stauf’s Coffee Roasters began offering specialty coffee to Central Ohio. From day one, we have been obsessed with the entire process of achieving the finest cup of coffee- from acquiring the best specialty grade green arabica beans available, to roasting exclusively on gas-fired drum roasters. All of the coffees that we offer are roasted by us, by hand, every day. Our profile method of roasting coffee in small batches allows us to concentrate on the best roast and flavor profile for each varietal and origin. You will not experience coffees of higher quality, consistency, or freshness. Our coffee is fresh and shipped within 48 hours of roasting. We are Columbus’ first micro-roaster, and we'll always provide you with the best coffee available.' NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Thurman Cafe
posts.note: Thurman Cafe is a bustling, rustic American haunt with oversized, toppings-loaded burgers and a full bar. You need to order the 'The Thurman Burger' which contains the following: overloaded with ham, sautéed mushrooms and onions, mozzarella and American cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickle, banana peppers, and mayo with chips and a pickle spear. Plus, you need a side of their French fries. If you're super hungry get 'The Thurmanator' which is the same as the 'The Thurman Burger' but has not one but two three-quarters of a pound burger patties.
